title: ClassSerializer missing its default no arg constructor in native mode
body:
### Describe the bug

Observed while trying to serialize an object containing a `Class` field in native mode:

```
com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException: Class com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ser.std.ClassSerializer has no
       │  default (no arg) constructor
   5   │     at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider.reportMappingProblem(SerializerProvider.java:1338)
   6   │     at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider._createAndCacheUntypedSerializer(SerializerProvider.java:1476)
   7   │     at com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider.findValueSerializer(SerializerProvider.java:597)
```

### Expected behavior

Serialization works out of the box for Class fields.

### Actual behavior

The `ClassSerializer` class needs to be registered for reflection manually.

### How to Reproduce?

* Reproducer: https://github.com/PierreBtz/quarkus-class-serializer-bug

* clone https://github.com/PierreBtz/quarkus-class-serializer-bug
* run `mvn verify -Pnative`, verify that the non native test (`ReproducerTest`) passes and the native test 
(`ReproducerNativeTest`) works. Observe the error in the logs under `target/quarkus.log`.
* Uncomment the code in the `Reproducer` class to make everything work.

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

Darwin MAC-pbeitz.local 22.5.0 Darwin Kernel Version 22.5.0: Thu Jun  8 22:22:20 PDT 2023; root:xnu-8796.121.3~7/RELEASE_ARM64_T6000 arm64

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17.0.4" 2022-07-19 OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.4+8 (build 17.0.4+8, mixed mode)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.2.0.Final (note if it helps, I initially encountered this in 2.16.6.Final)

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Apache Maven 3.8.8 (4c87b05d9aedce574290d1acc98575ed5eb6cd39

### Additional information

I'm not 100% sure it's a bug, but it seems strange to me that for a class registered for reflection, containing a `Class` object I need to also specify that the `ClassSerializer` is registered for reflection.
